core.name: Iconv

methods.name: close
methods.documentation: Close the Iconv resource and destroy the internal resource.

methods.name: convert
methods.documentation: Convert the text between the two different character sets. On error none is returned and you may call Iconv.errno() to get the error code.

methods.name: errno
methods.documentation: Get the latest errno returned from the underlying Iconv API.

core.documentation: This class allows characters set conversions using the Iconv library. Be aware that different versions of Iconv may have subtile differences.

core.name: File

methods.name: close
methods.documentation: Close the file and destroy the internal file resource.

methods.name: read
methods.documentation: Read data from file. On EOF an empty string is returned. On error none is returned.

methods.name: readline
methods.documentation: Read a line from file (without the CRLF or LF). If there are no more lines false is returned, and on error none is returned.

methods.name: seek
methods.documentation: Seek to the offset in the file. On error none is returned.

methods.name: tell
methods.documentation: Get the current file position. On error none is returned.

methods.name: getPath
methods.documentation: Get the path of a file. If no path information is available none is returned.

methods.name: toFFIValue
methods.documentation: Return a shared pointer to a C++ std::istream representing the current File content and position. On error none is returned.

methods.name: String
methods.documentation: Return a File resource containing the data.

methods.name: read
methods.documentation: Read all data from file. On error none is returned.

core.documentation: This class allows low level file access. A file resource is created for each File instance, this resource is automatically garbage collected (closed) once the object is destroyed.

core.name: MIME

methods.name: addHeader
methods.documentation: Add a header. The value may be encoded (if needed) and reformatted.

methods.name: appendPart
methods.documentation: Add a MIME part (child) object, this is useful when building a multipart MIME.

methods.name: setBody
methods.documentation: Set the MIME part body content. In case the MIME part has children (multipart) this will be the MIME parts preamble. The body will be encoded as either quoted-printable or base64 depending on the type of data if no Content-Transfer-Encoding header is explicitly added.

methods.name: setType
methods.documentation: Set the type field of the Content-Type header. The default type is text/plain, and for text/... the charset is always utf-8.

methods.name: setBoundary
methods.documentation: Set the MIME boundary for multipart/* messages. The default is to use an UUID.

methods.name: signDKIM
methods.documentation: Sign the MIME structure (message) using DKIM.

methods.name: toString
methods.documentation: Return the created MIME as a string. This function useful for debugging.

methods.name: queue
methods.detail: MIME->queue(string or array $sender, string or array $recipient, string $transportid [, array $options]): array
methods.documentation: Queue the message.

core.documentation: This is a MIME "string builder" used to construct MIME parts.

core.name: MailMessage

methods.name: reset
methods.documentation: Undo all changes on the message.

methods.name: snapshot
methods.documentation: Take a snapshot of the current state of the MIME object (to be used with MailMessage.restore()).

methods.name: restore
methods.documentation: Restore to a snapshot (to be used with MailMessage.snapshot()).

methods.name: modifyContent
methods.documentation: An advanced method of adding custom modification that will be applied to the message (it works the same way as other modification function, eg. MIMEPart.addHeader()). This function should not be used when are MIMEPart operations available doing the supposed modification.

methods.name: toFile
methods.documentation: Return a File class for the current MIME object (with all changes applied).

methods.name: toString
methods.documentation: Return the MailMessage as a string (with all changes applied).

methods.name: signDKIM
methods.detail: MailMessage->signDKIM(string $selector, string $domain, string $key [, array $options]): MailMessage or none
methods.documentation: Sign the message using DKIM. On error none is returned.

methods.name: verifyDKIM
methods.documentation: DKIM verify a DKIM-Signature or ARC-Message-Signature header. The header should include both the header name and value (unmodified).

methods.name: send
methods.detail: MailMessage->send(string or array $sender, array of (string or array) $recipients, string or array $server): array
methods.documentation: Try to send the message to the server.

methods.name: queue
methods.detail: MailMessage->queue(string or array $sender, string or array $recipient, string $transportid [, array $options]): array
methods.documentation: Queue the message.

methods.name: String
methods.documentation: Return a MailMessage resource containing the data.

core.documentation: This class extends the MIMEPart class, all instances of this class automatically holds a reference to the top level MIMEPart object.

core.name: MIMEPart

methods.name: getID
methods.documentation: Return the MIME part's ID.

methods.name: getSize
methods.documentation: Return the MIME part's size in bytes.

methods.name: getFileName
methods.documentation: Return the MIME part's file name (if it has one).

methods.name: getType
methods.documentation: Return the MIME part's Content-Type's type field (eg. text/plain).

methods.name: getHeader
methods.documentation: Return the value of a header (if multiple headers with the same name exists, the first will be returned). If no header is found, the value none is returned. The name is not case sensitive.

methods.name: getHeaders
methods.documentation: Return a list of header values. If no header is found, an empty list is returned. The name is not case sensitive.

methods.name: getHeaderNames
methods.documentation: Return a list of all header names, from the top. The names are in lower case.

methods.name: setHeader
methods.documentation: Overwrite existing header(s) or create a new header. The name is not case sensitive.

methods.name: addHeader
methods.documentation: Add a new header (at the top of the message).

methods.name: delHeader
methods.documentation: Delete all headers by the name. The name is not case sensitive.

methods.name: remove
methods.documentation: Remove this MIME part.

methods.name: getBody
methods.documentation: Get the body (content) of a MIME part. The content will be decoded according to the Content-Transfer-Encoding header.

methods.name: setBody
methods.documentation: Set the body (content) of a MIME part. The MIME parts encoding (Content-Transfer-Encoding) will be changed to the best readable match, that can be either 7bit, quoted-printable or base64 and the data will encoded as such.

methods.name: getPreamble
methods.documentation: Get the multipart MIME parts epilogue text. If the MIMEPart isn't a multipart MIME, none is returned.

methods.name: setPreamble
methods.documentation: Set the multipart MIME parts preamble text. If the MIMEPart isn't a multipart MIME, none is returned.

methods.name: getEpilogue
methods.documentation: Get the multipart MIME parts epilogue text. If the MIMEPart isn't a multipart MIME, none is returned.

methods.name: setEpilogue
methods.documentation: Set the multipart MIME parts epilogue text. If the MIMEPart isn't a multipart MIME, none is returned.

methods.name: prependPart
methods.documentation: Add a MIME part before this part. If the MIMEPart isn't a multipart MIME, none is returned.

methods.name: appendPart
methods.documentation: Add a MIME part after this part. If the MIMEPart isn't a multipart MIME, none is returned.

methods.name: replacePart
methods.documentation: Replace the current MIME part.

methods.name: findByType
methods.documentation: Find descendant parts (on any depth) based on their Content-Type.

methods.name: findByFileName
methods.documentation: Find descendant parts (on any depth) based on their file name.

methods.name: getParts
methods.documentation: Return child parts.

core.documentation: This class represent a MIME part in the MIME tree.

core.name: LDAP

methods.name: setoption
methods.documentation: Set LDAP connection options. On error none is returned.

methods.name: getoption
methods.documentation: Get LDAP connection options. On error none is returned.

methods.name: starttls
methods.documentation: Issue STARTTLS on LDAP connection. On error none is returned.

methods.name: bind
methods.documentation: Bind the LDAP connection. For anonymous bind, do not specify the credentials. On error none is returned.

methods.name: search
methods.documentation: Search LDAP connection in the current base and subtree. On error none is returned.

methods.name: unbind
methods.documentation: Unbind the LDAP connection. On error none is returned.

methods.name: errno
methods.documentation: Get the latest errno returned from the underlying OpenLDAP API.

methods.name: getpeerx509
methods.documentation: Get the peer certificate (X.509) as a X509 instance. On error none is returned.

methods.name: err2string
methods.documentation: Get a descriptive error message, uses OpenLDAP's ldap_err2string().

methods.name: filter_escape
methods.documentation: LDAP escape values to be used in LDAP filters.

methods.name: str2dn
methods.documentation: Parses the string representation of a distinguished name str into its components, returning an array of tupels. On error none is returned.

methods.name: dn2str
methods.documentation: Performs the inverse operation of LDAP.str2dn(), returning a string representation of dn with the necessary escaping. On error none is returned.

core.documentation: The LDAP class is a OpenLDAP wrapper class. The URI should be in the format of ldap:// or ldaps://. Multiple hosts may be given separated by space.

core.name: LDAPResult

methods.name: next
methods.documentation: Return the next result. If there are no more results false is returned, and on error none is returned.

core.documentation: A LDAP result iterable object which holds the result from an LDAP search.

core.name: Socket

methods.name: bind
methods.detail: Socket->bind(string $address [, number $port [, array $options]]): Socket or none
methods.documentation: Bind the socket to address and port. The address must match the Sockets address family. On error none is returned.

methods.name: close
methods.documentation: Close the socket and destroy the internal socket resource. On error none is returned.

methods.name: connect
methods.documentation: Connect the socket to address and port. The address must match the Sockets address family. On error none is returned.

methods.name: errno
methods.documentation: Get the latest errno returned from the underlying POSIX socket API.

methods.name: recv
methods.documentation: Receive data on socket. On error none is returned.

methods.name: send
methods.documentation: Send data on socket. On error none is returned.

methods.name: settimeout
methods.documentation: Set the timeout for socket operations.

methods.name: shutdown
methods.documentation: Shutdown the socket for receiving, sending or both. On error none is returned.

methods.name: AF
methods.documentation: Return the AF family of an address (either AF_INET or AF_INET6). A utility function helpful when constructing a Socket class. On error none is returned.

core.documentation: This class allows POSIX like socket(2) code. A socket resource is created for each Socket instance, this resource is automatically garbage collected (closed) once the object is destroyed.

core.name: TLSSocket

methods.name: handshake
methods.documentation: Perform the TLS/SSL handshake. If the handshake fails or the validation fails none is returned.

methods.name: recv
methods.documentation: Receive data on TLS/SSL socket. This function may perform an implicit handshake. On error none is returned.

methods.name: send
methods.documentation: Send data on TLS/SSL socket. This function may perform an implicit handshake. On error none is returned.

methods.name: shutdown
methods.documentation: Shut down the TLS/SSL connection. This function may need to be called multiple times. See SSL_shutdown(3) for details. On error none is returned.

methods.name: errno
methods.documentation: Get the latest errno returned from the underlying OpenSSL SSL(3) socket API.

methods.name: getpeerx509
methods.documentation: Get the peer certificate (X.509) as a X509 instance. On error none is returned.

core.documentation: This class allows OpenSSL like SSL(3) code. The TLSSocket class takes a connected Socket instance (SOCK_STREAM) and encapsulates any read and writes in TLS/SSL.

core.name: X509

methods.name: subject
methods.documentation: The subject of the certificate. The first field in the tuple is the name (eg. CN, OU) and the second is the value.

methods.name: issuer
methods.documentation: The issuer of the certificate. The first field in the tuple is the name (eg. CN, OU) and the second is the value.

methods.name: subject_alt_name
methods.documentation: The subject alt names (DNS) items

methods.name: version
methods.documentation: The version of the X.509 certificate

methods.name: serial_number
methods.documentation: The serial number in HEX

methods.name: not_valid_before
methods.documentation: The start date of the certificate (in unix time)

methods.name: not_valid_after
methods.documentation: The end date of the certificate (in unix time)

methods.name: public_key
methods.documentation: Export the public key in binary DER format (default) or in PEM format.

methods.name: export
methods.documentation: Export the certificate in binary DER format (default) or in PEM format.

methods.name: toFFIValue
methods.documentation: Return a pointer to a OpenSSL X509 object representing the current X509 resource.

core.documentation: This class allows you to parse an X509 resource. The X509 class takes a X509Resource.

core.name: FFI

methods.name: func
methods.detail: FFI->func(string $name, FFIType $arguments, FFIType $returntype): FFIFunction or none
methods.documentation: The name of the function to load, use FFI.type() to define the correct function signature. If the function is not found, none is returned.

methods.name: symbol
methods.documentation: Return a pointer to a global symbol in the library (eg. a variable). This function is the equivalent of dlsym(2). If the symbol is not found, none is returned.

methods.name: type
methods.documentation: A factory function for FFI types. This function is usually used to declare the function signature of an FFIFunction.

methods.name: cnumber
methods.documentation: Create an FFIValue containing a C number. It's a basic type, which exists for the lifetime of the returned value and passed by value.

methods.name: cstring
methods.documentation: Allocate a null-terminated C string (char *) in memory from a HSL string and return an FFIValue of pointer type pointing to that memory. This memory is owned by the FFIValue resource (use the FFI.detach() function to disclaim ownership). This function is intentionally not binary safe.

methods.name: callback
methods.documentation: Allocate a FFI callback function and return a FFIValue of pointer type pointing to that function. This pointer can be passed a pointer to a FFI function taking a C function pointer. This memory is owned by the FFIValue resource (use the FFI.detach() function to disclaim ownership). The callback function argument will be FFI types and the return type needs to be of FFI type as well.

methods.name: nullptr
methods.documentation: Create an FFIValue containing a NULL pointer.

methods.name: allocate
methods.documentation: Allocate memory of size in bytes and return an FFIValue of pointer type pointing to that memory. This memory is owned by the FFIValue resource (use the FFI.detach() function to disclaim ownership). The memory is initially filled with zeros.

methods.name: memcpy
methods.documentation: Copy the binary content of (string) data into memory location pointed to by an FFIValue of pointer type. The caller must make sure the pointer location is of sufficient length.

methods.name: byref
methods.documentation: Return an FFIValue of pointer type pointing to the FFIValue value.

methods.name: deref
methods.documentation: Return an FFIValue with FFIType of type with the value at the address pointed at by the FFIValue value. The default type is pointer. If the type is a pointer and dereferenced pointer points to NULL then none is returned.

methods.name: offset
methods.documentation: Return a new FFIValue of pointer type pointing the same memory with an offset.

methods.name: string
methods.documentation: Copy the binary content of a memory location pointed to by an FFIValue of pointer type to a HSL string. If the size is omitted the memory will be copied up to the first NULL character as a null-terminated C string (char *).

methods.name: number
methods.documentation: Convert an FFI value to a HSL number. The number type can safely represent all integers between +/-9007199254740991 (the equivalent of (2 ** 53) - 1). If you expect to work with greater numbers use FFI.number64().

methods.name: number64
methods.documentation: Convert an FFI value (uint64, sint64 or pointer) to a pair of two 32 bit integers ([high, low]). For signed negative numbers a two complement representation is used.

methods.name: attach
methods.documentation: Assign the ownership of the data pointed to by the pointer argument (FFIValue of pointer type). The default destructor is free. An optional destructor FFIFunction (should have one pointer argument) may be given.

methods.name: detach
methods.documentation: Remove the ownership of the data pointed to by the pointer argument (FFIValue of pointer type).

core.documentation: This class allows you to load a shared object/library.

methods.name: queue
methods.detail: EODMailMessage->queue(string or array $sender, string or array $recipient, string $transportid [, array $options]): array
methods.documentation: Queue the message.
